column4: The GNOME menu follows the freedesktop.org standards for menu systems. It uses an XML menu for layout and ini-type files for the actual entries in the menu
The system version of the menu is in /etc/xdg/menus/ but you can also create user versions in ~/.config/menus/
alacarte creates a user menu and merges the system menu into it (there is an xml tag to do this) then all of its changes automatically go on top of the system layout
what in particular did you need to know?
